question: A lawn 4 m on each side. If each lamp emits 250 cd, calculate the illumination at the center of the lawn.
What is the illumination on a surface that is 3.0 m below a 150-W incandescent lamp that emits a luminous flux of 2275 lm?
A lamp giving out 1200 lumens in all directions is suspended 8 m above the working plane. Calculate the illumination at a point on the working plane 6 m away from the foot of the lamp.

A corridor in Banco Central ng Pilipinas is lighted by 4 lamps spaced 10 m apart and suspended at a height of 5 m above the centre line of the floor. If each lamp gives 200 candles in all directions below the horizontal, find the illumination at the point on the floor mid-way between the second and third lamps.

A public school law requires a minimum illuminance of 160 lx at the surface of each student's desk. An architect's specifications call for classroom lights to be located 2.0 m above the desks. What is the minimum luminous flux that the lights must produce?
A room with an area of 6 x 9 m is illustrated by ten 80-W lamps. The luminous efficiency of the lamp is 80 lumens/W and the coefficient of utilization is 0.65. Find the average illumination.

A drawing office containing a number of boards and having a total effective area of 70 m$^2$ is lit by a number of 40 W incandescent lamps giving 11 lumens/W. An illumination of 80 lux is required on the drawing boards. Assuming that 60% of the total light emitted by the lamps is available for illuminating the drawing boards, estimate the number of lamps required.

The flux emitted by 100-W LED lamp is 1,400 lumens placed inside a frosted Christmas globe of 40 cm diameter and gives uniform brightness of 250 milli-lumens/m$^2$ in all directions. Calculate the lumens absorbed by globe?

The illumination in an office of University of Sto. Tomas of area 30 m × 10 m is to have a value of 250 lux and is to be provided by a number of 300-W LED lamps. If the coefficient of utilization is 0.4 and the depreciation factor 0.9, determine the number of lamps required. The luminous efficiency of each lamp is 14 lm/W:

Two lamps A and B of 200 candela and 400 candela respectively are situated 100 m apart. The height of A above the ground level is 10 m and that of B is 20 m. If a photometer is placed at the centre of the line joining the two lamp posts, calculate its reading.
What will be the secondary voltage at no load, if the primary of a 5 kVA, 220/110 V, 50 Hz transformer is fed at 110 V?
It is desired to have 4.13 mWb maximum flux in the core of a transformer operating at 110 V and 50 Hz. Determine the required number of turns in the primary.

A 3000/200 V, 50 Hz, single-phase transformer has a cross-sectional area of 150 cm² for the core. If the number of turns on the low-voltage winding is 80, determine the maximum value of flux density in the core.
An 80 kVA, 3200/400 V, 50 Hz single-phase transformer has 111 turns on the secondary winding. Calculate the cross-sectional area of the core, if the maximum flux density is 1.2 teslas.

The secondary of a 500 kVA, 4400/500 V, 50 Hz, single-phase transformer has 500 turns. The core has a flux density of 1.2 tesla and iron factor is 0.92. If the core is of square cross-section, find the width of the limb.
A 6600/660 V, 800 kVA transformer winding has a total impedance of 0.50 ohms in terms of primary winding. Determine the per unit rating of the transformer at full-load.

A 7.2 kV/500 V, 52 MVA transformer has a rating of 0.215 p.u. when connected to a load of 440 V. If this transformer is connected to a load of 120 MVA for a load of 500 V, what is the new p.u. rating?
A 50 kVA, 2300/230 V, 50 Hz transformer takes 200 watts and 0.3 A at no load. The primary resistance is 3.5 ohm. Determine the core loss.
A 230/110 V, single-phase transformer takes an input of 350 VA at no load and at rated voltage. The core loss is 110 W. Find the magnetizing component of no-load current.
At open circuit, a transformer of 10 kVA, 500/250 V, 50 Hz draws a power of 167 W at 0.745 A, 500 V. Determine the no-load power factor.
